intro: Veratrum chiengdaoense, commonly known as the Chiengdao lily, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to China. It belongs to the family Melanthiaceae and is characterized by its tall, erect stem and large, showy flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and mountainous regions. Its leaves are broad and lance-shaped, while its flowers are usually white or pale pink. Veratrum chiengdaoense contains various alkaloids, making it potentially toxic and requiring caution in handling.
